description: From Latin salivatus, past participle of salivare (“to spit out, also salivate”), from saliva (“spittle”).

verbs.description: salivate (third-person singular simple present salivates, present participle salivating, simple past and past participle salivated)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To show eager anticipation at the expectation of something.
examples: He's been salivating over the latest model sports car for a while now.
